messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 53 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: A multiscale model of terrain dynamics for real-time earthmoving simulation

Paper Abstract: Abstract A multiscale model for real-time simulation of terrain dynamics is explored. To represent the dynamics on different scales the model combines the description of soil as a continuous solid, as distinct particles and as rigid multibodies. The models are dynamically coupled to each other and to the earthmoving equipment. Agitated soil is represented by a hybrid of contacting particles and continuum solid, with the moving equipment and resting soil as geometric boundaries. Each zone of active soil is aggregated into distinct bodies, with the proper mass, momentum and frictional-cohesive properties, which constrain the equipment’s multibody dynamics. The particle model parameters are pre-calibrated to the bulk mechanical parameters for a wide range of different soils. The result is a computationally efficient model for earthmoving operations that resolve the motion of the soil, using a fast iterative solver, and provide realistic forces and dynamic for the equipment, using a direct solver for high numerical precision. Numerical simulations of excavation and bulldozing operations are performed to test the model and measure the computational performance. Reference data is produced using coupled discrete element and multibody dynamics simulations at relatively high resolution. The digging resistance and soil displacements with the real-time multiscale model agree with the reference model up to 10-25%, and run more than three orders of magnitude faster.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 53 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 53"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Interactive simulation of rigid body dynamics in computer graphics",
        "Computer Aided Kinematics and Dynamics of Mechanical Systems, Vol 1; Basic Methods.",
        "Multiscale problems and analysis of soil mechanics.",
        "Modeling Soil: Realtime Dynamic Models for Soil Slippage and Manipulation.",
        "Development of a virtual reality excavator simulator: a mathematical model of excavator digging and a calculation methodology.",
        "The fundamental equation of earth-moving mechanics.",
        "Soil Cutting and Tillage.",
        "Soil deformation models for real-time simulation: A hybrid approach.",
        "Real-time simulation of mining and earthmoving operations: A level set-based model for tool-induced terrain deformations.",
        "Advances in physically-based modeling of deformable soil for real-time operator training simulators.",
        "Deformable terrain model for the real-time multibody simulation of a tractor with a hydraulically driven front-loader.",
        "3d frictional contact and impact multibody dynamics. a comparison of algorithms suitable for real-time applications.",
        "Parallel Particles (P2): A Parallel Position Based Approach for Fast and Stable Simulation of Granular Materials.",
        "Examining the smooth and nonsmooth discrete element approach to granular matter.",
        "Warm starting the projected gauss-seidel algorithm for granular matter simulation.",
        "Granular Media: Between Fluid and Solid, 1st Edition.",
        "On an analytical solution for the damped hertzian spring.",
        "Quantifying operability of working machines.",
        "Virtual operator modeling method for excavator trenching.",
        "Iterative learning-based admittance control for autonomous excavation.",
        "A discrete numerical model for granular assemblies.",
        "Review: Calibration of the discrete element method.",
        "Interaction between soil and a wide cutting blade using the discrete element method.",
        "A discrete element model and its experimental validation for the prediction of draft forces in cohesive soil.",
        "Discrete element modelling of large soil deformations under heavy vehicles.",
        "Anisotropic elasticity and yielding of a natural plastic clay.",
        "Computational Methods for Plasticity: Theory and Applications.",
        "Flows of dense granular media.",
        "A semi-implicit material point method for the continuum simulation of granular materials.",
        "A moving least squares material point method with displacement discontinuity and two-way rigid body coupling.",
        "Finite cavity expansion in dilatant soils: loading analysis.",
        "Regularized, stabilized, variational methods for multibodies.",
        "Numerical Methods for Nonsmooth Dynamical Systems: Applications in Mechanics and Electronics,",
        "Discrete-element Modeling of Granular Materials.",
        "Identification of rolling resistance as a shape parameter in sheared granular media.",
        "Parametrization and validation of a nonsmooth discrete element method for simulating flows of iron ore green pellets.",
        "Spook: a variational time-stepping scheme for rigid multibody systems subject to dry frictional contacts.",
        "Linear Complementarity, Linear and Nonlinear Programming.",
        "Texture-Dependent Rigid-Plastic Behavior.",
        "A model for the dynamics of sandpile surfaces.",
        "Wet granular materials.",
        "Soilflex: A model for prediction of soil stresses and soil compaction due to agricultural field traffic including a synthesis of analytical approaches.",
        "Terramechanics based terrain deformation for real-time off-road vehicle simulation.",
        "Mobility Prediction of Multi-Body Vehicle Dynamics Handling Simulations on Deformable Terrain.",
        "Integration of digging forces in a multi-body-system model of an excavator.",
        "Pressure in Silos.",
        "AGX Dynamics.",
        "Direct sparse factorization of blocked saddle point matrices.",
        "Vdb: High-resolution sparse volumes with dynamic topology.",
        "Data-driven model order reduction for granular media.",
        "Domain randomization for transferring deep neural networks from simulation to the real world.",
        "A Novel Method of Soil Parameter Identification and Force Prediction for Automatic Excavation.",
        "Hierarchical Multiscale Modeling of Tire–Soil Interaction for Off-Road Mobility Simulation."
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 53 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in A multiscale model of terrain dynamics for real-time earthmoving simulation, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
